```ex wave_hmi/lib/wave_web/components/wave_components/inverter_status.ex defmodule WaveWeb.WaveComponents.InverterRow do use WaveWeb, :wave_component import WaveWeb.WaveComponents.OpStateBadge def inverter_row(assigns) do ~H"""

{gettext("STBD Trawl inverters")}

<.inverter_status name="1" id="TAXX" op_status={1} /> <.inverter_status name="2" id="TAXX" op_status={1} /> <.inverter_status name="3" id="TAXX" op_status={1} /> <.inverter_status name="4" id="TAXX" op_status={1} />

{gettext("Levelwind")}

<.inverter_status name="L" id="TAXX" op_status={1} />

{gettext("SOW")}

<.inverter_status name="1" id="TAXX" op_status={1} />

{gettext("PORT Trawl inverters")}

<.inverter_status name="1" id="TAXX" op_status={1} /> <.inverter_status name="2" id="TAXX" op_status={1} /> <.inverter_status name="3" id="TAXX" op_status={1} /> <.inverter_status name="4" id="TAXX" op_status={1} />

{gettext("Levelwind")}

<.inverter_status name="L" id="TAXX" op_status={1} />
""" end attr :name, :string, required: true attr :id, :string, required: true attr :op_state, :integer, required: true def inverter_status(assigns) do ~H"""

{@name}

ID {@id}

<.op_state_badge op_state={@op_state} />
""" end end ``` change op_status to op_state Below is the updated code with all instances of “op_status” changed to “op_state”: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- defmodule WaveWeb.WaveComponents.InverterRow do use WaveWeb, :wave_component import WaveWeb.WaveComponents.OpStateBadge def inverter_row(assigns) do ~H"""

<%= gettext("STBD Trawl inverters") %>

<.inverter_status name="1" id="TAXX" op_state={1} /> <.inverter_status name="2" id="TAXX" op_state={1} /> <.inverter_status name="3" id="TAXX" op_state={1} /> <.inverter_status name="4" id="TAXX" op_state={1} />

<%= gettext("Levelwind") %>

<.inverter_status name="L" id="TAXX" op_state={1} />

<%= gettext("SOW") %>

<.inverter_status name="1" id="TAXX" op_state={1} />

<%= gettext("PORT Trawl inverters") %>

<.inverter_status name="1" id="TAXX" op_state={1} /> <.inverter_status name="2" id="TAXX" op_state={1} /> <.inverter_status name="3" id="TAXX" op_state={1} /> <.inverter_status name="4" id="TAXX" op_state={1} />

<%= gettext("Levelwind") %>

<.inverter_status name="L" id="TAXX" op_state={1} />
""" end attr :name, :string, required: true attr :id, :string, required: true attr :op_state, :integer, required: true def inverter_status(assigns) do ~H"""

<%= @name %>

ID <%= @id %>

<.op_state_badge op_state={@op_state} />
""" end end -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- All instances that were previously “op_status” have been replaced with “op_state,” and the code now passes the “op_state” attribute accordingly.
